private_information: I specialize in extracting formal action schemas, predicates, and typing assumptions from natural language task descriptions.
I will not output PDDL directly; I will provide a compact structured schema summary that another agent can compile to PDDL.
domain_builder.goal: Produce a consistent, minimal set of predicates and lifted action schemas matching the public specification.

private_information: I collate objects, initial facts, and goal facts for multiple scenarios while keeping names stable and consistent.
I will not output PDDL directly; I will provide well-formed instances with explicit object universes and fact sets.
state_curator.goal: Aggregate the two scenario statements into two coherent instances with explicit object lists, initial states, and goals.

private_information: I validate plans by simulating preconditions and effects step-by-step and reporting discrepancies or confirmations.
I will not output PDDL directly; I will return a verification report and planning hints.
plan_checker.goal: Validate the provided plan for Scenario A, explain any mismatches, and provide high-level ordering guidance for Scenario B.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the schema, instances, and validation into a single consistent PDDL domain and corresponding problem files suitable for the Fast Downward solver.

public_information: This task models object manipulation with six actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted.
Predicates inventory (all boolean): unary predicates: hand(?x), cats(?x), sneeze(?x), spring(?x), stupendous(?x), texture(?x); binary predicates: next(?x ?y), vase(?x ?y), collect(?x ?y).
Action paltry(x y z): preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, vase x y, next y z; add effects: next x z; delete effects: vase x y.
Action sip(x y z): preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, next x z, next y z; add effects: vase x y; delete effects: next x z.
Action clip(x y z): preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, next x z; add effects: vase x y; delete effects: next x z.
Action wretched(x y z w): preconditions: sneeze x, texture y, texture z, stupendous w, next x y, collect y w, collect z w; add effects: next x z; delete effects: next x y.
Action memory(x y z): preconditions: cats x, spring y, spring z, next x y; add effects: next x z; delete effects: next x y.
Action tightfisted(x y z): preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, vase x y; add effects: next x z; delete effects: vase x y.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_8, next object_1 object_6, next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_6, next object_4 object_6, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario A goal: next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7.

Scenario A provided plan: clip object_11 object_5 object_9; wretched object_5 object_9 object_8 object_3; tightfisted object_11 object_5 object_8; clip object_12 object_4 object_6; sip object_11 object_0 object_8; sip object_10 object_0 object_8; memory object_0 object_8 object_6; paltry object_11 object_0 object_6; clip object_11 object_4 object_6; paltry object_10 object_0 object_6; clip object_10 object_4 object_6; wretched object_4 object_6 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_7; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_7; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_7.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_9, next object_0 object_7, next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_5, next object_12 object_6, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_7, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Scenario B goal: next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7, next object_9 object_6.

domain_synthesis.system_prompt: You are a formalization specialist. Derive a lifted action schema set and predicate inventory from the provided public information. Do not output PDDL. Output a structured summary inside <schema></schema> containing: types (use a single type obj unless a stricter typing is explicitly required), predicates (name and arguments), and actions (name, parameters over type obj, preconditions, add effects, delete effects). Ensure names and arities match the public specification exactly and keep all identifiers lowercase.
domain_synthesis.prompt: Your name is domain_builder. Consider the following public information: {environment->public_information}. Extract the consistent minimal set of predicates and the six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted). Preserve argument roles and effect polarity. Do not invent new predicates. Return only the structured summary wrapped in <schema>...</schema> and keep it concise.

instances.system_prompt: You curate problem instances. Using the schema summary, assemble two instances: Scenario A and Scenario B. Do not output PDDL. Output inside <instances></instances> the following for each scenario: objects (the explicit set of symbols appearing in the facts and goals, including object_0..object_12 and any others referenced), init (set of ground predicates), goal (conjunctive set of ground predicates). Ensure symbol stability across scenarios and do not alter fact polarity.
instances.prompt: Your name is state_curator. Use the public information to list objects, initial facts, and goals for Scenario A and Scenario B. Respect the exact facts and goals as stated. Emit a compact, machine-readable block in <instances>...</instances> with two subsections <scenario name="A">...</scenario> and <scenario name="B">...</scenario>. Do not emit PDDL.

validate.system_prompt: You validate plans by simulating action preconditions and effects. Do not output PDDL. Provide a report inside <validation></validation> that includes: for Scenario A, a stepwise check of the provided plan with pass or fail at each step and the updated facts when relevant; a final verdict whether the goal is achieved; for Scenario B, propose a high-level action ordering or subgoals that appear necessary given the preconditions, without fabricating facts.
validate.prompt: Your name is plan_checker. Use the action semantics and the Scenario A plan from the public information to validate it against Scenario A init and goal. Then provide guidance for Scenario B where no plan was provided. Keep the report concise and structured inside <validation>...</validation>.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-instance PDDL compiler targeting the Fast Downward solver. Produce one PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (Scenario A and Scenario B). Enclose the domain between <domain></domain>. Enclose each problem between <problem name="A"></problem> and <problem name="B"></problem>. Use only the predicates and actions provided by domain_builder and consistent with the public information. Use lowercase names, :requirements :strips :typing, a single type obj and declare all constants in :objects. Ensure preconditions and effects match exactly the described semantics; avoid derived predicates and numeric fluents. For each problem, include the full object set, initial state, and goal. The output must be directly consumable by Fast Downward.
compile_pddl.prompt: Integrate the schema from domain_builder, the instances from state_curator, and the validation insights from plan_checker to compile a single PDDL domain and two problem files. Respect the identifiers object_0..object_12 and the exact facts for both scenarios. Keep action names paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameters over type obj consistent with the public specification. Return only the PDDL domain and the two PDDL problems wrapped in the required tags.
